meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strange or mysterious.
meanings.sent1: The uncanninesses of the old house made me feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The uncanninesses of the situation left us all puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The uncanninesses of the talking cat made us laugh nervously.
meanings.sent4: The uncanninesses of the fog enveloped the town in an eerie shroud.
meanings.sent5: The uncanninesses of the abandoned carnival were hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being uncomfortably strange or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: A sense of uncanninesses crept over me as I entered the dark room.
meanings.sent2: The uncanninesses of the new school made the students anxious.
meanings.sent3: The uncanninesses of the clown's outfit made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The uncanninesses of the silence in the forest felt like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The uncanninesses of the empty street at night sent shivers down my spine.
